column4: sup guys, i'm having a nvidia-related resolution issue, can anybody lend me a hand? i get no response from #nvidia...
i can't set a specific resolution, 1600x900
does nvidia-settings give an error when it's launched/
i'm on a philips HDTV, i know it can do it and i can even set it to 1080p
no, it actually just won't display that res in nvidia-settings
i tried adding the mode using xrandr
it "kinda" works, but parts of the screen are missing

if you run:   gksudo nvidia-xconfig; gksudo nvidia-settings     set the res to something and click "save to x config file". Close nvidia-settings and run:  gksudo gedit /etc/X11/xorg.conf     and change the resolution in the screen section to what you desire and rebot
if you get no display, drop to root recovery mode and rename or delete /etc/X11/xorg.conf    and reboot. Note the X in X11 is CAPITALIZED, Linux is case sensitive
gonna try it now, ty in advance
hey dude, it's the guy with the resolution problem again
didn't work, i got black screen
i assume it's EDID-related... after all i'm not having high-res limitation, it's just the res that i want that doesn't show in nvidia-settings
yea, sounds like your screen isnt reporting it/ Good screens do that
you'll need to fight the xorg.conf file til it plaus nice
fact is, there's a point when i can get 1600x900_60 to work, but parts of the screen go missing
here is mine:  http://paste.ubuntu.com/816638/   my screen sets a stupidly high res with insane DPI resulting in huge text and tony everything else
